Articles.Content:
Something I'd really like would be a mod that would add camera equipment to the available science equipment.  In real life cameras played, and still do play, a huge role in space exploration, but apart from RSS/RP-1, seems to not be a thing in KSP as far as I know.

Does anyone know if such a mod exists?

Edited June 8, 2020 by The Flying Kerbal

- SCANSat with the new update

- DMagic Orbital Science

-BDB

-Tarsier Space Technologies

are what I can think of off the top of my head

Edited June 8, 2020 by Clamp-o-Tron
Great stuff and thank you.  I'll have a look at them later.

This is the only mod I know that you get science points for taking pictures, there's a camera with film and a digital camera. Simply update the dll to work on 1.9.1. It seems to be that it is abandoned.
BDArmory contains FLIR and its counterpart. Not that scientific, but still nice and can be bound to particular targets.

TST adds space telescopes and a rover camera which can both save their images to your hard drive if you like.

SCANsat has recently added visual scans which can make colour images of the planet/moon’s surface and those can also be saved to your hard drive.

ProbesPlus contains a part that does landing site imaging, although it’s just a science experiment and doesn’t actually take real photographs.
